verses.text: And sending away the crowds, Jesus got into the boat and came to the region of Magadan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and Sadducees came up, and testing Jesus, they asked Him to show them a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He replied to them, “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning, ‘There will be a storm today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Do you know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but cannot discern the signs of the times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign; and a sign will not be given it, except the sign of Jonah.” And He left them and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples came to the other side of the sea, but they had forgotten to bring any bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Watch out and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to discuss this among themselves, saying, “He said that because we did not bring any bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, aware of this, said, “You men of little faith, why do you discuss among yourselves that you have no bread?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not yet understand or remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets full you picked up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many large baskets full you picked up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How is it that you do not understand that I did not speak to you concerning bread? But beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they understood that He did not say to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus came into the district of Caesarea Philippi, He was asking His disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Some say John the Baptist; and others, Elijah; but still others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Blessed are you, Simon Barjona, because flesh and blood did not reveal this to you, but My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also say to you that you are Peter, and upon this rock I will build My church; and the gates of Hades will not overpower it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven; and whatever you bind on earth shall have been bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall have been loosed in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He warned the disciples that they should tell no one that He was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time Jesus began to show His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem, and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised up on the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him, saying, “God forbid it, Lord! This shall never happen to You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He turned and said to Peter, “Get behind Me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to Me; for you are not setting your mind on God’s interests, but man’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to His disciples, “If anyone wishes to come after Me, he must deny himself, and take up his cross and follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wishes to save his life will lose it; but whoever loses his life for My sake will find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world and forfeits his soul? Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man is going to come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and will then repay every man according to his deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly I say to you, there are some of those who are standing here who will not taste death until they see the Son of Man coming in His kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days later Jesus took with Him Peter and James and John his brother, and led them up on a high mountain by themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He was transfigured before them; and His face shone like the sun, and His garments became as white as light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Moses and Elijah appeared to them, talking with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here; if You wish, I will make three tabernacles here, one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and behold, a voice out of the cloud said, “This is My beloved Son, with whom I am well-pleased; listen to Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples heard this, they fell face down to the ground and were terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus came to them and touched them and said, “Get up, and do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And lifting up their eyes, they saw no one except Jesus Himself alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were coming down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying, “Tell the vision to no one until the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His disciples asked Him, “Why then do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered and said, “Elijah is coming and will restore all things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I say to you that Elijah already came, and they did not recognize him, but did to him whatever they wished. So also the Son of Man is going to suffer at their hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples understood that He had spoken to them about John the Baptist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the crowd, a man came up to Jesus, falling on his knees before Him and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is a lunatic and is very ill; for he often falls into the fire and often into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought him to Your disciples, and they could not cure him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said, “You unbelieving and perverted generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring him here to Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus rebuked him, and the demon came out of him, and the boy was cured at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why could we not drive it out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Because of the littleness of your faith; for truly I say to you, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move; and nothing will be impossible to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [But this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting.”]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were gathering together in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will kill Him, and He will be raised on the third day.” And they were deeply grieved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Capernaum, those who collected the two-drachma tax came to Peter and said, “Does your teacher not pay the two-drachma tax?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Yes.” And when he came into the house, Jesus spoke to him first, saying, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth collect customs or poll-tax, from their sons or from strangers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peter said, “From strangers,” Jesus said to him, “Then the sons are exempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, so that we do not offend them, go to the sea and throw in a hook, and take the first fish that comes up; and when you open its mouth, you will find a shekel. Take that and give it to them for you and Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus and said, “Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He called a child to Himself and set him before them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Truly I say to you, unless you are converted and become like children, you will not enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever then humbles himself as this child, he is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever receives one such child in My name receives Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to stumble, it would be better for him to have a heavy millstone hung around his neck, and to be drowned in the depth of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to the world because of its stumbling blocks! For it is inevitable that stumbling blocks come; but woe to that man through whom the stumbling block comes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw it from you; it is better for you to enter life crippled or lame, than to have two hands or two feet and be cast into the eternal fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it from you. It is better for you to enter life with one eye, than to have two eyes and be cast into the fiery hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See that you do not despise one of these little ones, for I say to you that their angels in heaven continually see the face of My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [For the Son of Man has come to save that which was lost.]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you think? If any man has a hundred sheep, and one of them has gone astray, does he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountains and go and search for the one that is straying?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it turns out that he finds it, truly I say to you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your brother sins, go and show him his fault in private; if he listens to you, you have won your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not listen to you, take one or two more with you, so that by the mouth of two or three witnesses every fact may be confirmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he refuses to listen to them, tell it to the church; and if he refuses to listen even to the church, let him be to you as a Gentile and a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, whatever you bind on earth shall have been bound in heaven; and whatever you loose on earth shall have been loosed in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Again I say to you, that if two of you agree on earth about anything that they may ask, it shall be done for them by My Father who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where two or three have gathered together in My name, I am there in their midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter came and said to Him, “Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me and I forgive him? Up to seven times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “I do not say to you, up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this reason the kingdom of heaven may be compared to a king who wished to settle accounts with his slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had begun to settle them, one who owed him ten thousand talents was brought to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since he did not have the means to repay, his lord commanded him to be sold, along with his wife and children and all that he had, and repayment to be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the slave fell to the ground and prostrated himself before him, saying, ‘Have patience with me and I will repay you everything.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lord of that slave felt compassion and released him and forgave him the debt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that slave went out and found one of his fellow slaves who owed him a hundred denarii; and he seized him and began to choke him, saying, ‘Pay back what you owe.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his fellow slave fell to the ground and began to plead with him, saying, ‘Have patience with me and I will repay you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was unwilling and went and threw him in prison until he should pay back what was owed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when his fellow slaves saw what had happened, they were deeply grieved and came and reported to their lord all that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then summoning him, his lord said to him, ‘You wicked slave, I forgave you all that debt because you pleaded with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Should you not also have had mercy on your fellow slave, in the same way that I had mercy on you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his lord, moved with anger, handed him over to the torturers until he should repay all that was owed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My heavenly Father will also do the same to you, if each of you does not forgive his brother from your heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished these words, He departed from Galilee and came into the region of Judea beyond the Jordan;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and large crowds followed Him, and He healed them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came to Jesus, testing Him and asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason at all?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered and said, “Have you not read that He who created them from the beginning made them male and female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they are no longer two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Why then did Moses command to give her a certificate of divorce and send her away?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Because of your hardness of heart Moses permitted you to divorce your wives; but from the beginning it has not been this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I say to you, whoever divorces his wife, except for immorality, and marries another woman commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said to Him, “If the relationship of the man with his wife is like this, it is better not to marry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said to them, “Not all men can accept this statement, but only those to whom it has been given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother’s womb; and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men; and there are also eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. He who is able to accept this, let him accept it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some children were brought to Him so that He might lay His hands on them and pray; and the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Let the children alone, and do not hinder them from coming to Me; for the kingdom of heaven belongs to such as these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After laying His hands on them, He departed from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And someone came to Him and said, “Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may obtain eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to him, “Why are you asking Me about what is good? There is only One who is good; but if you wish to enter into life, keep the commandments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Him, “Which ones?” And Jesus said, “You shall not commit murder; You shall not commit adultery; You shall not steal; You shall not bear false witness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor your father and mother; and You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The young man said to Him, “All these things I have kept; what am I still lacking?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “If you wish to be complete, go and sell your possessions and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the young man heard this statement, he went away grieving; for he was one who owned much property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to His disciples, “Truly I say to you, it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the disciples heard this, they were very astonished and said, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking at them Jesus said to them, “With people this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said to Him, “Behold, we have left everything and followed You; what then will there be for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you, that you who have followed Me, in the regeneration when the Son of Man will sit on His glorious throne, you also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or farms for My name’s sake, will receive many times as much, and will inherit eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last; and the last, first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius for the day, he sent them into his vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the market place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to those he said, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ And so they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing around; and he said to them, ‘Why have you been standing here idle all day long?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, ‘Because no one hired us.’ He said to them, ‘You go into the vineyard too.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his foreman, ‘Call the laborers and pay them their wages, beginning with the last group to the first.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those hired about the eleventh hour came, each one received a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those hired first came, they thought that they would receive more; but each of them also received a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they received it, they grumbled at the landowner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘These last men have worked only one hour, and you have made them equal to us who have borne the burden and the scorching heat of the day.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered and said to one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong; did you not agree with me for a denarius?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take what is yours and go, but I wish to give to this last man the same as to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I wish with what is my own? Or is your eye envious because I am generous?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the last shall be first, and the first last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was about to go up to Jerusalem, He took the twelve disciples aside by themselves, and on the way He said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem; and the Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn Him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will hand Him over to the Gentiles to mock and scourge and crucify Him, and on the third day He will be raised up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to Jesus with her sons, bowing down and making a request of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to her, “What do you wish?” She said to Him, “Command that in Your kingdom these two sons of mine may sit one on Your right and one on Your left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink?” They said to Him, “We are able.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “My cup you shall drink; but to sit on My right and on My left, this is not Mine to give, but it is for those for whom it has been prepared by My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hearing this, the ten became indignant with the two brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called them to Himself and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great men exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not this way among you, but whoever wishes to become great among you shall be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever wishes to be first among you shall be your slave;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were leaving Jericho, a large crowd followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two blind men sitting by the road, hearing that Jesus was passing by, cried out, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd sternly told them to be quiet, but they cried out all the more, “Lord, Son of David, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus stopped and called them, and said, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Lord, we want our eyes to be opened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moved with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes; and immediately they regained their sight and followed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had approached Jerusalem and had come to Bethphage, at the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “Go into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied there and a colt with her; untie them and bring them to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord has need of them,’ and immediately he will send them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This took place to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Say to the daughter of Zion,
‘Behold your King is coming to you,
Gentle, and mounted on a donkey,
Even on a colt, the foal of a beast of burden.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples went and did just as Jesus had instructed them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought the donkey and the colt, and laid their coats on them; and He sat on the coats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Most of the crowd spread their coats in the road, and others were cutting branches from the trees and spreading them in the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: When He had entered Jerusalem, all the city was stirred, saying, “Who is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowds were saying, “This is the prophet Jesus, from Nazareth in Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus entered the temple and drove out all those who were buying and selling in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who were selling doves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer’; but you are making it a robbers’ den.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that He had done, and the children who were shouting in the temple, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they became indignant
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Him, “Do You hear what these children are saying?” And Jesus said to them, “Yes; have you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of infants and nursing babies You have prepared praise for Yourself’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He left them and went out of the city to Bethany, and spent the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the morning, when He was returning to the city, He became hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing a lone fig tree by the road, He came to it and found nothing on it except leaves only; and He said to it, “No longer shall there ever be any fruit from you.” And at once the fig tree withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing this, the disciples were amazed and asked, “How did the fig tree wither all at once?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Truly I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it will happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all things you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He entered the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to Him while He was teaching, and said, “By what authority are You doing these things, and who gave You this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I will also ask you one thing, which if you tell Me, I will also tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The baptism of John was from what source, from heaven or from men?” And they began reasoning among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the people; for they all regard John as a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And answering Jesus, they said, “We do not know.” He also said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first and said, ‘Son, go work today in the vineyard.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered, ‘I will not’; but afterward he regretted it and went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man came to the second and said the same thing; and he answered, ‘I will, sir’; but he did not go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of the two did the will of his father?” They said, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you that the tax collectors and prostitutes will get into the kingdom of God before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John came to you in the way of righteousness and you did not believe him; but the tax collectors and prostitutes did believe him; and you, seeing this, did not even feel remorse afterward so as to believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to another parable. There was a landowner who planted a vineyard and put a wall around it and dug a wine press in it, and built a tower, and rented it out to vine-growers and went on a journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the harvest time approached, he sent his slaves to the vine-growers to receive his produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The vine-growers took his slaves and beat one, and killed another, and stoned a third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent another group of slaves larger than the first; and they did the same thing to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterward he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the vine-growers saw the son, they said among themselves, ‘This is the heir; come, let us kill him and seize his inheritance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took him, and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vine-growers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “He will bring those wretches to a wretched end, and will rent out the vineyard to other vine-growers who will pay him the proceeds at the proper seasons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said to them, “Did you never read in the Scriptures,
‘The stone which the builders rejected,
This became the chief corner stone;
This came about from the Lord,
And it is marvelous in our eyes’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I say to you, the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people, producing the fruit of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces; but on whomever it falls, it will scatter him like dust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard His parables, they understood that He was speaking about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they sought to seize Him, they feared the people, because they considered Him to be a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a king who gave a wedding feast for his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he sent out his slaves to call those who had been invited to the wedding feast, and they were unwilling to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he sent out other slaves saying, ‘Tell those who have been invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and my fattened livestock are all butchered and everything is ready; come to the wedding feast.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they paid no attention and went their way, one to his own farm, another to his business,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the rest seized his slaves and mistreated them and killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the king was enraged, and he sent his armies and destroyed those murderers and set their city on fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to his slaves, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go therefore to the main highways, and as many as you find there, invite to the wedding feast.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those slaves went out into the streets and gathered together all they found, both evil and good; and the wedding hall was filled with dinner guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the king came in to look over the dinner guests, he saw a man there who was not dressed in wedding clothes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said to him, ‘Friend, how did you come in here without wedding clothes?’ And the man was speechless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king said to the servants, ‘Bind him hand and foot, and throw him into the outer darkness; in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many are called, but few are chosen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went and plotted together how they might trap Him in what He said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sent their disciples to Him, along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that You are truthful and teach the way of God in truth, and defer to no one; for You are not partial to any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell us then, what do You think? Is it lawful to give a poll-tax to Caesar, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus perceived their malice, and said, “Why are you testing Me, you hypocrites?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Show Me the coin used for the poll-tax.” And they brought Him a denarius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Whose likeness and inscription is this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Caesar’s.” Then He said to them, “Then render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s; and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And hearing this, they were amazed, and leaving Him, they went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day some Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) came to Jesus and questioned Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: asking, “Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies having no children, his brother as next of kin shall marry his wife, and raise up children for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers with us; and the first married and died, and having no children left his wife to his brother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so also the second, and the third, down to the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Last of all, the woman died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the resurrection, therefore, whose wife of the seven will she be? For they all had married her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered and said to them, “You are mistaken, not understanding the Scriptures nor the power of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But regarding the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not the God of the dead but of the living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at His teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Pharisees heard that Jesus had silenced the Sadducees, they gathered themselves together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, a lawyer, asked Him a question, testing Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, which is the great commandment in the Law?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to him, “‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the great and foremost commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is like it, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On these two commandments depend the whole Law and the Prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them a question:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you think about the Christ, whose son is He?” They said to Him, “The son of David.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Then how does David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord,’ saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at My right hand,
Until I put Your enemies beneath Your feet”’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If David then calls Him ‘Lord,’ how is He his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one was able to answer Him a word, nor did anyone dare from that day on to ask Him another question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying: “The scribes and the Pharisees have seated themselves in the chair of Moses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore all that they tell you, do and observe, but do not do according to their deeds; for they say things and do not do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tie up heavy burdens and lay them on men’s shoulders, but they themselves are unwilling to move them with so much as a finger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they do all their deeds to be noticed by men; for they broaden their phylacteries and lengthen the tassels of their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They love the place of honor at banquets and the chief seats in the synagogues,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and respectful greetings in the market places, and being called Rabbi by men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But do not be called Rabbi; for One is your Teacher, and you are all brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not call anyone on earth your father; for One is your Father, He who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be called leaders; for One is your Leader, that is, Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the greatest among you shall be your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever exalts himself shall be humbled; and whoever humbles himself shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you shut off the kingdom of heaven from people; for you do not enter in yourselves, nor do you allow those who are entering to go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense you make long prayers; therefore you will receive greater condemnation.]
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, because you travel around on sea and land to make one proselyte; and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘Whoever swears by the temple, that is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the temple is obligated.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fools and blind men! Which is more important, the gold or the temple that sanctified the gold?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, ‘Whoever swears by the altar, that is nothing, but whoever swears by the offering on it, he is obligated.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind men, which is more important, the offering, or the altar that sanctifies the offering?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, whoever swears by the altar, swears both by the altar and by everything on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever swears by the temple, swears both by the temple and by Him who dwells within it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever swears by heaven, swears both by the throne of God and by Him who sits upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint and dill and cummin, and have neglected the weightier provisions of the law: justice and mercy and faithfulness; but these are the things you should have done without neglecting the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind guides, who strain out a gnat and swallow a camel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the dish, but inside they are full of robbery and self-indulgence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You blind Pharisee, first clean the inside of the cup and of the dish, so that the outside of it may become clean also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs which on the outside appear beautiful, but inside they are full of dead men’s bones and all uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you, too, outwardly appear righteous to men, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the prophets and adorn the monuments of the righteous,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘If we had been living in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partners with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you testify against yourselves, that you are sons of those who murdered the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fill up, then, the measure of the guilt of your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You serpents, you brood of vipers, how will you escape the sentence of hell?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, behold, I am sending you prophets and wise men and scribes; some of them you will kill and crucify, and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that upon you may fall the guilt of all the righteous blood shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, all these things will come upon this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, the way a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were unwilling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, your house is being left to you desolate!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I say to you, from now on you will not see Me until you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came out from the temple and was going away when His disciples came up to point out the temple buildings to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to them, “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you, not one stone here will be left upon another, which will not be torn down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things happen, and what will be the sign of Your coming, and of the end of the age?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered and said to them, “See to it that no one misleads you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will mislead many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hearing of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not frightened, for those things must take place, but that is not yet the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom, and in various places there will be famines and earthquakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all these things are merely the beginning of birth pangs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then they will deliver you to tribulation, and will kill you, and you will be hated by all nations because of My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time many will fall away and will betray one another and hate one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many false prophets will arise and will mislead many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because lawlessness is increased, most people’s love will grow cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who endures to the end, he will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore when you see the abomination of desolation which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is on the housetop must not go down to get the things out that are in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is in the field must not turn back to get his cloak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But pray that your flight will not be in the winter, or on a Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then there will be a great tribulation, such as has not occurred since the beginning of the world until now, nor ever will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unless those days had been cut short, no life would have been saved; but for the sake of the elect those days will be cut short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then if anyone says to you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ,’ or ‘There He is,’ do not believe him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false Christs and false prophets will arise and will show great signs and wonders, so as to mislead, if possible, even the elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have told you in advance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if they say to you, ‘Behold, He is in the wilderness,’ do not go out, or, ‘Behold, He is in the inner rooms,’ do not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the lightning comes from the east and flashes even to the west, so will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever the corpse is, there the vultures will gather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light, and the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He will send forth His angels with a great trumpet and they will gather together His elect from the four winds, from one end of the sky to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn the parable from the fig tree: when its branch has already become tender and puts forth its leaves, you know that summer is near;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so, you too, when you see all these things, recognize that He is near, right at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But of that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels of heaven, nor the Son, but the Father alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the coming of the Son of Man will be just like the days of Noah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as in those days before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered the ark,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they did not understand until the flood came and took them all away; so will the coming of the Son of Man be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there will be two men in the field; one will be taken and one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding at the mill; one will be taken and one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore be on the alert, for you do not know which day your Lord is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be sure of this, that if the head of the house had known at what time of the night the thief was coming, he would have been on the alert and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason you also must be ready; for the Son of Man is coming at an hour when you do not think He will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who then is the faithful and sensible slave whom his master put in charge of his household to give them their food at the proper time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that slave whom his master finds so doing when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you that he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that evil slave says in his heart, ‘My master is not coming for a long time,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and begins to beat his fellow slaves and eat and drink with drunkards;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the master of that slave will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour which he does not know,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will cut him in pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites; in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the kingdom of heaven will be comparable to ten virgins, who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of them were foolish, and five were prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when the foolish took their lamps, they took no oil with them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the prudent took oil in flasks along with their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while the bridegroom was delaying, they all got drowsy and began to sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at midnight there was a shout, ‘Behold, the bridegroom! Come out to meet him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all those virgins rose and trimmed their lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foolish said to the prudent, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the prudent answered, ‘No, there will not be enough for us and you too; go instead to the dealers and buy some for yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were going away to make the purchase, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding feast; and the door was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later the other virgins also came, saying, ‘Lord, lord, open up for us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered, ‘Truly I say to you, I do not know you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on the alert then, for you do not know the day nor the hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For it is just like a man about to go on a journey, who called his own slaves and entrusted his possessions to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To one he gave five talents, to another, two, and to another, one, each according to his own ability; and he went on his journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the one who had received the five talents went and traded with them, and gained five more talents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same manner the one who had received the two talents gained two more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who received the one talent went away, and dug a hole in the ground and hid his master’s money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now after a long time the master of those slaves came and settled accounts with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who had received the five talents came up and brought five more talents, saying, ‘Master, you entrusted five talents to me. See, I have gained five more talents.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave. You were faithful with a few things, I will put you in charge of many things; enter into the joy of your master.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also the one who had received the two talents came up and said, ‘Master, you entrusted two talents to me. See, I have gained two more talents.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful slave. You were faithful with a few things, I will put you in charge of many things; enter into the joy of your master.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And the one also who had received the one talent came up and said, ‘Master, I knew you to be a hard man, reaping where you did not sow and gathering where you scattered no seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the ground. See, you have what is yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But his master answered and said to him, ‘You wicked, lazy slave, you knew that I reap where I did not sow and gather where I scattered no seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you ought to have put my money in the bank, and on my arrival I would have received my money back with interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore take away the talent from him, and give it to the one who has the ten talents.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For to everyone who has, more shall be given, and he will have an abundance; but from the one who does not have, even what he does have shall be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Throw out the worthless slave into the outer darkness; in that place there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the angels with Him, then He will sit on His glorious throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations will be gathered before Him; and He will separate them from one another, as the shepherd separates the sheep from the goats;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He will put the sheep on His right, and the goats on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the King will say to those on His right, ‘Come, you who are blessed of My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was hungry, and you gave Me something to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave Me something to drink; I was a stranger, and you invited Me in;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: naked, and you clothed Me; I was sick, and you visited Me; I was in prison, and you came to Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the righteous will answer Him, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry, and feed You, or thirsty, and give You something to drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when did we see You a stranger, and invite You in, or naked, and clothe You?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When did we see You sick, or in prison, and come to You?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The King will answer and say to them, ‘Truly I say to you, to the extent that you did it to one of these brothers of Mine, even the least of them, you did it to Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then He will also say to those on His left, ‘Depart from Me, accursed ones, into the eternal fire which has been prepared for the devil and his angels;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I was hungry, and you gave Me nothing to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave Me nothing to drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was a stranger, and you did not invite Me in; naked, and you did not clothe Me; sick, and in prison, and you did not visit Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they themselves also will answer, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not take care of You?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He will answer them, ‘Truly I say to you, to the extent that you did not do it to one of the least of these, you did not do it to Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished all these words, He said to His disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man is to be handed over for crucifixion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests and the elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the high priest, named Caiaphas;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they plotted together to seize Jesus by stealth and kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were saying, “Not during the festival, otherwise a riot might occur among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, at the home of Simon the leper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a woman came to Him with an alabaster vial of very costly perfume, and she poured it on His head as He reclined at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the disciples were indignant when they saw this, and said, “Why this waste?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this perfume might have been sold for a high price and the money given to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus, aware of this, said to them, “Why do you bother the woman? For she has done a good deed to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you always have the poor with you; but you do not always have Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when she poured this perfume on My body, she did it to prepare Me for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be spoken of in memory of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the twelve, named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “What are you willing to give me to betray Him to you?” And they weighed out thirty pieces of silver to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From then on he began looking for a good opportunity to betray Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Go into the city to a certain man, and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, “My time is near; I am to keep the Passover at your house with My disciples.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples did as Jesus had directed them; and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening came, Jesus was reclining at the table with the twelve disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were eating, He said, “Truly I say to you that one of you will betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Being deeply grieved, they each one began to say to Him, “Surely not I, Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He answered, “He who dipped his hand with Me in the bowl is the one who will betray Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is to go, just as it is written of Him; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas, who was betraying Him, said, “Surely it is not I, Rabbi?” Jesus said to him, “You have said it yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were eating, Jesus took some bread, and after a blessing, He broke it and gave it to the disciples, and said, “Take, eat; this is My body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had taken a cup and given thanks, He gave it to them, saying, “Drink from it, all of you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this is My blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I say to you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in My Father’s kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away because of Me this night, for it is written, ‘I will strike down the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I have been raised, I will go ahead of you to Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said to Him, “Even though all may fall away because of You, I will never fall away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you that this very night, before a rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “Even if I have to die with You, I will not deny You.” All the disciples said the same thing too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to His disciples, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be grieved and distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved, to the point of death; remain here and keep watch with Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He went a little beyond them, and fell on His face and prayed, saying, “My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from Me; yet not as I will, but as You will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “So, you men could not keep watch with Me for one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep watching and praying that you may not enter into temptation; the spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away again a second time and prayed, saying, “My Father, if this cannot pass away unless I drink it, Your will be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again He came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He left them again, and went away and prayed a third time, saying the same thing once more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He came to the disciples and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Behold, the hour is at hand and the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up, let us be going; behold, the one who betrays Me is at hand!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While He was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came up accompanied by a large crowd with swords and clubs, who came from the chief priests and elders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he who was betraying Him gave them a sign, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the one; seize Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Judas went to Jesus and said, “Hail, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said to him, “Friend, do what you have come for.” Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and seized Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, one of those who were with Jesus reached and drew out his sword, and struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back into its place; for all those who take up the sword shall perish by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or do you think that I cannot appeal to My Father, and He will at once put at My disposal more than twelve legions of angels?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How then will the Scriptures be fulfilled, which say that it must happen this way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus said to the crowds, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest Me as you would against a robber? Every day I used to sit in the temple teaching and you did not seize Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all this has taken place to fulfill the Scriptures of the prophets.” Then all the disciples left Him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had seized Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter was following Him at a distance as far as the courtyard of the high priest, and entered in, and sat down with the officers to see the outcome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the chief priests and the whole Council kept trying to obtain false testimony against Jesus, so that they might put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not find any, even though many false witnesses came forward. But later on two came forward,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “This man stated, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to rebuild it in three days.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest stood up and said to Him, “Do You not answer? What is it that these men are testifying against You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus kept silent. And the high priest said to Him, “I adjure You by the living God, that You tell us whether You are the Christ, the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have said it yourself; nevertheless I tell you, hereafter you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest tore his robes and said, “He has blasphemed! What further need do we have of witnesses? Behold, you have now heard the blasphemy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: what do you think?” They answered, “He deserves death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spat in His face and beat Him with their fists; and others slapped Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Prophesy to us, You Christ; who is the one who hit You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard, and a servant-girl came to him and said, “You too were with Jesus the Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it before them all, saying, “I do not know what you are talking about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone out to the gateway, another servant-girl saw him and said to those who were there, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again he denied it with an oath, “I do not know the man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little later the bystanders came up and said to Peter, “Surely you too are one of them; for even the way you talk gives you away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began to curse and swear, “I do not know the man!” And immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said, “Before a rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” And he went out and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when morning came, all the chief priests and the elders of the people conferred together against Jesus to put Him to death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they bound Him, and led Him away and delivered Him to Pilate the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Judas, who had betrayed Him, saw that He had been condemned, he felt remorse and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood.” But they said, “What is that to us? See to that yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he threw the pieces of silver into the temple sanctuary and departed; and he went away and hanged himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests took the pieces of silver and said, “It is not lawful to put them into the temple treasury, since it is the price of blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they conferred together and with the money bought the Potter’s Field as a burial place for strangers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason that field has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of the one whose price had been set by the sons of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they gave them for the Potter’s Field, as the Lord directed me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor questioned Him, saying, “Are You the King of the Jews?” And Jesus said to him, “It is as you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while He was being accused by the chief priests and elders, He did not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to Him, “Do You not hear how many things they testify against You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He did not answer him with regard to even a single charge, so the governor was quite amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to release for the people any one prisoner whom they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time they were holding a notorious prisoner, called Barabbas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the people gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release for you? Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he knew that because of envy they had handed Him over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him a message, saying, “Have nothing to do with that righteous Man; for last night I suffered greatly in a dream because of Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds to ask for Barabbas and to put Jesus to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the governor said to them, “Which of the two do you want me to release for you?” And they said, “Barabbas.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “Then what shall I do with Jesus who is called Christ?” They all said, “Crucify Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Why, what evil has He done?” But they kept shouting all the more, saying, “Crucify Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate saw that he was accomplishing nothing, but rather that a riot was starting, he took water and washed his hands in front of the crowd, saying, “I am innocent of this Man’s blood; see to that yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people said, “His blood shall be on us and on our children!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he released Barabbas for them; but after having Jesus scourged, he handed Him over to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole Roman cohort around Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stripped Him and put a scarlet robe on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after twisting together a crown of thorns, they put it on His head, and a reed in His right hand; and they knelt down before Him and mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spat on Him, and took the reed and began to beat Him on the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had mocked Him, they took the scarlet robe off Him and put His own garments back on Him, and led Him away to crucify Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were coming out, they found a man of Cyrene named Simon, whom they pressed into service to bear His cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to a place called Golgotha, which means Place of a Skull,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they gave Him wine to drink mixed with gall; and after tasting it, He was unwilling to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had crucified Him, they divided up His garments among themselves by casting lots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And sitting down, they began to keep watch over Him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And above His head they put up the charge against Him which read, “THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time two robbers were crucified with Him, one on the right and one on the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those passing by were hurling abuse at Him, wagging their heads
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “You who are going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save Yourself! If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way the chief priests also, along with the scribes and elders, were mocking Him and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He saved others; He cannot save Himself. He is the King of Israel; let Him now come down from the cross, and we will believe in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He trusts in God; let God rescue Him now, if He delights in Him; for He said, ‘I am the Son of God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The robbers who had been crucified with Him were also insulting Him with the same words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now from the sixth hour darkness fell upon all the land until the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” that is, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of those who were standing there, when they heard it, began saying, “This man is calling for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately one of them ran, and taking a sponge, he filled it with sour wine and put it on a reed, and gave Him a drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the rest of them said, “Let us see whether Elijah will come to save Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus cried out again with a loud voice, and yielded up His spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom; and the earth shook and the rocks were split.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and coming out of the tombs after His resurrection they entered the holy city and appeared to many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the centurion, and those who were with him keeping guard over Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things that were happening, became very frightened and said, “Truly this was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many women were there looking on from a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee while ministering to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among them was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was evening, there came a rich man from Arimathea, named Joseph, who himself had also become a disciple of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered it to be given to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock; and he rolled a large stone against the entrance of the tomb and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the next day, the day after the preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered together with Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Sir, we remember that when He was still alive that deceiver said, ‘After three days I am to rise again.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, give orders for the grave to be made secure until the third day, otherwise His disciples may come and steal Him away and say to the people, ‘He has risen from the dead,’ and the last deception will be worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to them, “You have a guard; go, make it as secure as you know how.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and made the grave secure, and along with the guard they set a seal on the stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the Sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to look at the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, a severe earthquake had occurred, for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven and came and rolled away the stone and sat upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his appearance was like lightning, and his clothing as white as snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The guards shook for fear of him and became like dead men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid; for I know that you are looking for Jesus who has been crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, for He has risen, just as He said. Come, see the place where He was lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go quickly and tell His disciples that He has risen from the dead; and behold, He is going ahead of you into Galilee, there you will see Him; behold, I have told you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they left the tomb quickly with fear and great joy and ran to report it to His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, Jesus met them and greeted them. And they came up and took hold of His feet and worshiped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid; go and take word to My brethren to leave for Galilee, and there they will see Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while they were on their way, some of the guard came into the city and reported to the chief priests all that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had assembled with the elders and consulted together, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came by night and stole Him away while we were asleep.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if this should come to the governor’s ears, we will win him over and keep you out of trouble.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took the money and did as they had been instructed; and this story was widely spread among the Jews, and is to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the eleven disciples proceeded to Galilee, to the mountain which Jesus had designated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some were doubtful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus came up and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: teaching them to observe all that I commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
